com.projectReflection

Class PackageReflection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projectReflection.ProjectReflection

  • public class PackageReflection
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows for the mapping of classes in a project.
    The original class (ClassFinder) is found at http://stackoverflow.com/a/15519745 It was an answer by sp00m to a question on stackoverflow accessed on 2015/06/02. However, it has been heavily modified by Jason Bogle in order to add more functionality.
    Author:
    Jason L. Bogle

    • Method Detail

      • find

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> find(java.lang.String scannedPackage)
        Generates a List of classes that exist within a specified package.
        Parameters:
        scannedPackage - Specifies the package to scan for classes
        Returns:
        A list of classes found

      • find

        private static java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> find(java.io.File file,
                                                       java.lang.String scannedPackage)
        Constructs a List of Classes starting with a specific file or directory. It finds ".class" files and checks to see if the corresponding class exists. If the class exists, it is added to the List, classes. This method is only called from within this class.
        Parameters:
        file - Start point for creating the List of classes
        scannedPackage - The name of the package being scanned.
        Returns:
        A list of classes found

      • classExists

        public static boolean classExists(java.lang.String className,
                                  java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> classes)
        Checks to see if a specific class exists in a list of classes.
        Parameters:
        className - The specified name of the class being checked for existence - this can be the simple name (for example: "Bar") or it can be the fully qualified name (for example: "com.foo.Bar")
        classes - The list of classes being searched
        Returns:
        true if the class is found
        false if the class is not found

      • classExists

        public static boolean classExists(java.lang.String className,
                                  java.lang.String packageName)
        Checks to see if a specific class exists in a package. This method calls classExists(String className, List<Class<?>> classes) after generating a list of classes found in the package specified by "packageName".
        Parameters:
        className - The specified name of the class being checked for existence - this can be the simple name (for example: "Bar") or it can be the fully qualified name (for example: "com.foo.Bar")
        packageName - Specifies the package name to use when generating a list of classes
        Returns:
        true if the class is found
        false if the class is not found

      • getClass

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getClass(java.lang.String className,
                                          java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> classes)
        Gets a specified class from a list of classes. It compares the class name to the classes and returns the class if it is found. Otherwise, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        className - The specified name of the class being checked for existence - this can be the simple name (for example: "Bar") or it can be the fully qualified name (for example: "com.foo.Bar")
        classes - The list of classes being searched
        Returns:
        the class if exists
        null if the class does not exist

      • getClass

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getClass(java.lang.String className,
                                          java.lang.String packageName)
        Gets a specified class from a package. It creates a list of classes and calls getClass(String className, List<Class<?>> classes) which returns the class if it is found. Otherwise, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        className - The specified name of the class being checked for existence - this can be the simple name (for example: "Bar") or it can be the fully qualified name (for example: "com.foo.Bar")
        packageName - The specified package to be used when creating the list of classes
        Returns:
        the class if exists
        null if the class does not exist

      • methodExists

        public static boolean methodExists(java.lang.String methodName,
                                   java.lang.Class<?> theClass)
        Checks to see if a method exists in a class. It loops through the methods of a class and checks for a match to the method name. If an exact match is found, true is returned. Otherwise, false is returned.
        Parameters:
        methodName - The name of the method to search for
        theClass - The class to search for the method in
        Returns:
        true if the method is found in the class
        false otherwise

      • methodExists

        public static boolean methodExists(java.lang.String methodName,
                                   java.lang.String className,
                                   java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> classes)
        Checks to see if a method exists in a class in a list. It gets the class from the provided list of classes then it calls methodExists(String methodName, Class<?> theClass) If an exact match is found, true is returned. Otherwise, false is returned.
        Parameters:
        methodName - The name of the method to search for
        className - The name of the class to search for the method in - this can be the simple name (for example: "Bar") or it can be the fully qualified name (for example: "com.foo.Bar")
        classes - The list of classes to search for the class in
        Returns:
        true if the method is found in the class
        false otherwise

      • methodExists

        public static boolean methodExists(java.lang.String methodName,
                                   java.lang.String className,
                                   java.lang.String packageName)
        Checks to see if a method exists in a class in a package. It generates a list of classes from the given package name then calls PackageReflectionmethodExists(String methodName, String className, List<Class<?>> classes)
        Parameters:
        methodName - The name of the method to search for
        className - The name of the class to search for the method in - this can be the simple name (for example: "Bar") or it can be the fully qualified name (for example: "com.foo.Bar")
        packageName - The name of the package to search for the class in
        Returns:
        true if the method is found in the class
        false otherwise

      • getMethod

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.reflect.Method> getMethod(java.lang.String methodName,
                                                                      java.lang.Class<?> theClass)
        Gets a list of methods that match the specified method name in a class. It loops through the methods of a class and adds any methods that match the specified name to a list of methods. That list of methods is returned. If no matches are returned, an empty list is returned.
        Parameters:
        methodName - The method name to search for
        theClass - The class to search in for the method name
        Returns:
        a list of methods that match the exact method name
        the list is empty if no matches are found

      • getMethod

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.reflect.Method> getMethod(java.lang.String methodName,
                                                                      java.lang.String className,
                                                                      java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> classes)
        Gets a list of methods that match the specified method name in a class in a list. It gets the class from the list, then calls getMethod(String methodName, Class<?> theClass)
        Parameters:
        methodName - The method name to search for
        className - The name of the class to search for the method in - this can be the simple name (for example: "Bar") or it can be the fully qualified name (for example: "com.foo.Bar")
        classes - The list of classes to search for the class in
        Returns:
        a list of methods that match the exact method name
        the list is empty if no matches are found

      • getMethod

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.reflect.Method> getMethod(java.lang.String methodName,
                                                                      java.lang.String className,
                                                                      java.lang.String packageName)
        Gets a list of methods that match the specified method name in a class in a package. It generates a list of classes then calls getMethod(String methodName, String className, List<Class<?>> classes)
        Parameters:
        methodName - The method name to search for
        className - The name of the class to search for the method in - this can be the simple name (for example: "Bar") or it can be the fully qualified name (for example: "com.foo.Bar")
        packageName - The name of the package to search for the class in
        Returns:
        a list of methods that match the exact method name
        the list is empty if no matches are found

      • getMethod

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.reflect.Method> getMethod(java.util.regex.Pattern methodName,
                                                                      java.lang.Class<?> theClass)
        Gets a list of methods that match the regular expression and exist in the given class. It loops through the methods of the class and adds each method that matches the regular expression to a list. That list is returned. If no matches are found, the list is empty.
        Parameters:
        methodName - The regular expression used for matching the method names
        theClass - The class to search in for the method name
        Returns:
        a list of methods that match the regular expression
        the list is empty if no matches are found

      • getMethod

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.reflect.Method> getMethod(java.util.regex.Pattern methodName,
                                                                      java.lang.String className,
                                                                      java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> classes)
        Gets a list of methods that match the regular expression and exist in a class that is in the given list of classes. It gets the class from the list then calls getMethod(Pattern methodName, Class<?> theClass)
        Parameters:
        methodName - The regular expression used for matching the method names
        className - The name of the class to search for the method in - this can be the simple name (for example: "Bar") or it can be the fully qualified name (for example: "com.foo.Bar")
        classes - The list of classes to search for the class in
        Returns:
        a list of methods that match the regular expression
        the list is empty if no matches are found

      • getMethod

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.reflect.Method> getMethod(java.util.regex.Pattern methodName,
                                                                      java.lang.String className,
                                                                      java.lang.String packageName)
        Gets a list of methods that match the regular expression and exist in a class that is in the given package. It gets a list of classes from the given package then calls getMethod(Pattern methodName, String className, List<Class<?>> classes)
        Parameters:
        methodName - The regular expression used for matching the method names
        className - The name of the class to search for the method in - this can be the simple name (for example: "Bar") or it can be the fully qualified name (for example: "com.foo.Bar")
        packageName - The name of the package to search for the class in
        Returns:
        a list of methods that match the regular expression
        the list is empty if no matches are found

      • fieldExists

        public static boolean fieldExists(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                  java.lang.Class<?> theClass)
        Checks to see if a field exist in the given class. It loops through the fields in the class and returns true if an exact match is found. Otherwise it returns false.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field to search for
        theClass - The class to search in for the field
        Returns:
        true if the field is found
        otherwise false

      • fieldExists

        public static boolean fieldExists(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                  java.lang.String className,
                                  java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> classes)
        Checks to see if a field exists in a class in a list. It gets the class from the list and calls fieldExists(String fieldName, Class<?> theClass)
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field to search for
        className - The name of the class to search for the method in - this can be the simple name (for example: "Bar") or it can be the fully qualified name (for example: "com.foo.Bar")
        classes - The list of classes to search for the class in
        Returns:
        true if the field is found
        otherwise false

      • fieldExists

        public static boolean fieldExists(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                  java.lang.String className,
                                  java.lang.String packageName)
        Checks to see if a field exists in a class in a package. It generates a list of classes in the package, then calls fieldExists(String fieldName, String className, List<Class<?>> classes)
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field to search for
        className - The name of the class to search for the method in - this can be the simple name (for example: "Bar") or it can be the fully qualified name (for example: "com.foo.Bar")
        packageName - The name of the package to search for the class in
        Returns:
        true if the field is found
        otherwise false

      • getField

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field getField(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                               java.lang.Class<?> theClass)
        Gets the field that matches the given field name exactly and exists in the given class. It loops through the fields in the class and returns the field if it is found. Otherwise, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field to search for
        theClass - The class to search in for the field
        Returns:
        the field if a match is found
        otherwise, null

      • getField

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field getField(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                               java.lang.String className,
                                               java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> classes)
        Gets a field of a class in a list. It gets the class from the given list then calls getField(String fieldName, Class<?> theClass)
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field to search for
        className - The name of the class to search for the method in - this can be the simple name (for example: "Bar") or it can be the fully qualified name (for example: "com.foo.Bar")
        classes - The list of classes to search for the class in
        Returns:
        the field if a match is found
        otherwise, null

      • getField

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field getField(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                               java.lang.String className,
                                               java.lang.String packageName)
        Gets a field of a class in a package. Generates a list of classes from the package name, then calls getField(String, String, List) getField(String fieldName, String className, List<Class<?>> classes)
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field to search for
        className - The name of the class to search for the method in - this can be the simple name (for example: "Bar") or it can be the fully qualified name (for example: "com.foo.Bar")
        packageName - The name of the package to search for the class in
        Returns:
        the field if a match is found
        otherwise, null

      • getField

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.reflect.Field> getField(java.util.regex.Pattern fieldName,
                                                                    java.lang.Class<?> theClass)
        Gets a list of fields that match the given regular expression and exist in the given class. It loops through the fields of the class and checks for matches. When a match is found, it is added to a list of fields. That list is returned. If no matches are found, the list is empty.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field to search for
        theClass - The class to search in for the field
        Returns:
        list of fields that match the regular expression
        list is empty if no matches were found

                                                                    java.lang.String className,
                                                                    java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> classes)
